title: How to Make Banana Bread Pudding

steps.headline: Prepare the bread layer.
steps.description: Spread the bread cubes around a pre-greased 2-quart casserole dish. Lightly push them down and drizzle the melted butter on top.

steps.headline: Make the mixture.
steps.description: Combine the milk, beaten eggs, sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt in a medium bowl. Fold in the bananas, making sure you don't break any of the slices.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture over the bread.
steps.description: Distribute the mixture around the pan. Ensure that all of the bread pieces are soaked by lightly pushing them down with a fork.

steps.headline: Bake the mixture.
steps.description: Put it in the oven for 40 minutes. Check the bread by sticking a toothpick in and pulling it out clean.

steps.headline: Melt the butter.
steps.description: Place a small saucepan over medium high heat and allow the butter to melt.

steps.headline: Add the remaining sauce ingredients, except the vanilla.
steps.description: Whisk the mixture constantly to avoid burning.

steps.headline: Allow the mixture to come to a boil.
steps.description: Continue cooking for a minute and then remove from the heat.

steps.headline: Measure and pour the vanilla in.
Serve the bread pudding.
steps.description: Drizzle the sauce on top of warm servings of the bread pudding.

text: Making the Bread Pudding Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).  Prepare the bread layer. Spread the bread cubes around a pre-greased 2-quart casserole dish. Lightly push them down and drizzle the melted butter on top. Make the mixture. Combine the milk, beaten eggs, sugar, nutmeg, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt in a medium bowl. Fold in the bananas, making sure you don't break any of the slices. Pour the mixture over the bread. Distribute the mixture around the pan. Ensure that all of the bread pieces are soaked by lightly pushing them down with a fork. Bake the mixture. Put it in the oven for 40 minutes. Check the bread by sticking a toothpick in and pulling it out clean. Making the Sauce Melt the butter. Place a small saucepan over medium high heat and allow the butter to melt. Add the remaining sauce ingredients, except the vanilla. Whisk the mixture constantly to avoid burning. Allow the mixture to come to a boil. Continue cooking for a minute and then remove from the heat. Measure and pour the vanilla in.  Serve the bread pudding. Drizzle the sauce on top of warm servings of the bread pudding.
